## Current Openings

### Postdoctoral Research Associate

::: {.position-card}

**Status:** Open (Start date flexible)  
**Duration:** 2 years, renewable  
**Funding:** USDA-NIFA grant

**Project:** Development of nanopore-based surveillance tools for foodborne pathogens in poultry production systems

**Qualifications:**

- Ph.D. in bioinformatics, microbiology, computational biology, or related field
- Experience with next-generation sequencing data analysis
- Proficiency in Python and/or R
- Strong publication record
- Excellent communication skills

**Preferred:**

- Experience with Oxford Nanopore Technologies
- Background in food safety or public health microbiology
- Experience with pipeline development (Snakemake, Nextflow)

**To Apply:** Send CV, cover letter, and contact information for three references to [l.zhang@msstate.edu](mailto:l.zhang@msstate.edu) with subject line "Postdoc Application - [Your Name]"

:::

We occasionally host visiting scholars and sabbatical visitors. If you're interested in a research visit (minimum 3 months), please contact Dr. Li to discuss possibilities.

## What We're Looking For

Beyond specific qualifications, successful lab members share these qualities:

✓ **Curiosity** — Genuine interest in understanding how things work  
✓ **Persistence** — Willingness to troubleshoot and iterate  
✓ **Communication** — Ability to explain your work clearly  
✓ **Collaboration** — Comfort working in a team environment  
✓ **Integrity** — Commitment to honest, rigorous science  
✓ **Growth mindset** — Eagerness to learn new skills

We do **not** expect you to already be an expert. We will teach you what you need to know.

---

## What to Expect

### First Year (Graduate Students)

- Lab rotations (if applicable) or immediate project start
- Coursework in your degree program
- Weekly one-on-one meetings with Dr. Li
- Lab meetings and journal club participation
- Development of Individual Development Plan (IDP)

### Onboarding

All new members receive:

- Lab safety and computational resource orientation
- Introduction to lab protocols and expectations
- Assignment of a lab buddy (experienced member for questions)
- Access to shared resources, code repositories, and documentation

### Typical Week

| Activity | Time |
|----------|------|
| Research (wet lab, computational, reading) | 30-40 hrs |
| Lab meeting | 1 hr |
| One-on-one with PI | 30 min |
| Journal club | 1 hr |
| Coursework (if applicable) | Varies |

### Work-Life Balance

We believe in sustainable productivity. The lab has flexible hours (core hours: 10am-3pm), and I do not expect weekend or evening work except near deadlines. Mental health and personal well-being come first.

## FAQ

**Q: Do I need programming experience to join the lab?**  
A: Not necessarily! For graduate students, we can teach you what you need. However, demonstrating willingness to learn (e.g., taking a free online course) strengthens your application.

**Q: Is the GRE required?**  
A: No. MSU does not require the GRE for most graduate programs.

**Q: Can international students apply?**  
A: Yes! We welcome international applicants. MSU's [Office of International Services](https://www.oiss.msstate.edu/) can assist with visa requirements.

**Q: What if I'm interested but not sure about a specific project?**  
A: That's fine! Email Dr. Li to discuss your interests and we can identify good fits.

**Q: How long does the application process take?**  
A: After initial contact, expect 2-4 weeks for an initial response. Graduate admissions decisions are typically made in February-March for fall admission.

**Q: Is there funding for conference travel?**  
A: Yes. Graduate students are supported to attend at least one conference per year. Additional travel funding is available for presentations.

## How to Apply

::: {.apply-steps}

**Step 1: Initial Contact**

Email Dr. Li at [l.zhang@msstate.edu](mailto:l.zhang@msstate.edu) with:

- Subject line: "[Position Type] Inquiry - [Your Name]"
- Brief introduction (1 paragraph)
- Why you're interested in our research (1 paragraph)
- Attached CV/resume

**Step 2: Discussion**

If there's a potential fit, we'll schedule a video call to discuss your background, interests, and goals.

**Step 3: Formal Application**

For graduate positions, submit formal application through MSU Graduate School. For postdocs, provide full application materials.

**Step 4: Interview**

Invited candidates will interview (virtual or in-person) with Dr. Li and lab members.

:::
